author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Armed robber wanted after attacking Mattress Warehouse employee in South Jersey
text:
Summary by Ground News An unknown man, wearing all black, with a face covering entered the store and demanded money. The suspect was carrying a black weapon which police believe to have been a knife. The individual physically assaulted the worker and then locked them in a closet before fleeing the store. The worker was able to free themselves from the closet and immediately called the police. title: Wildfire breaks out in Merced County, CA | Sacramento Bee
text:
Fires
Breaking: Paul Fire reported in Merced County on May 7
The creation of this content included the use of AI based on templates created, reviewed and edited by journalists in the newsroom. Read more on our AI policy here.
First discovered: 3:11 p.m. May 7
Initial location: Merced County, Calif.
Fire type: Wildfire
Fire name: Paul
A new wildfire was reported today at 3:11 p.m. in Merced County.
Paul Fire has been burning on state land. There is no update on the containment of the fire and its cause has yet to be determined.

author: Emma Soteriou
title: New Year's Eve weather chaos: Snow, 75mph winds and rain set to sweep UK as revellers... - LBC
text: Dom Joly 6pm - 9pm New Year's Eve weather chaos: Snow, 75mph winds and rain set to sweep UK as revellers told 'do not travel' 29 December 2023, 18:22 Snow, strong winds and heavy rain will sweep the UK this weekend, causing weather chaos for New Year's Eve revellers. Listen to this article Loading audio... The Met Office issued yellow weather warnings for wind, rain and snow over the weekend, with large swathes of the UK set to be affected. Southern England and Wales will face strong winds between 11am on Saturday and 3am on Sunday, with gusts of 50mph expected. They could even reach 75mph in coastal areas in the west and south. Rain warnings are also in place for Northern Ireland and Wales. Torrential downpours are expected to cause flooding, power cuts and travel disruption across roads, trains, planes and ferries. Meanwhile, Scotland is set to be hit by snow, with up to 10cm expected across higher ground and 3cm on lower ground. It comes after Storm Gerrit caused chaos throughout this week. The Met Office said its Irish counterpart, Met Eireann, could even name another storm - Storm Henk. Read more: [New Year's Eve revellers told to travel as early as Friday to avoid weekend of train chaos](/news/new-years-eve-travel-updates/) Read more: [Brits face 'Beast from the East' return in January with Brits 'to end up in the freezer'](/news/uk-weather-beast-from-the-east-return-january/) Low pressure will bring more wet and windy weather to the UK and warnings for heavy rain, strong winds and snow have been issued for this weekend ‚ö†Ô∏è‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) Latest info here üëâ [https://t.co/QwDLMfRBfs] Stay [#WeatherAware]‚ö†Ô∏è [pic.twitter.com/4cysjM1jry] [December 29, 2023] Met Office meteorologist Alex Burkill said: "The weather looks like it will be unsettled with further strong winds and heavy rain as we go through the last weekend of 2023. "A deep area of low pressure is set to push its way in from the west, this low could be named Storm Henk by the Irish Met Service, Met √âireann, because it is likely to be across the Republic of Ireland where we see the strongest winds. "Nonetheless, Saturday is going to turn wet and windy across the UK, this band of intense rain is going to push its way east and north-eastwards as we go through the day bringing strong winds with it, the risk of gales or even severe gales in exposed spots. "As well as the rain we are also likely to see some significant snow across northern areas particularly over the higher grounds in Scotland. "For the highest ground we could see 10-20cm of snow building up, and even for some lower levels there‚Äôs potential for some snow accumulation. Even as low as 100m up we could see some slushy snow. "So, likely to see travel disruption again because of the wind, the rain and some snow, like we have seen over some recent days." Any New Years Eve plans? üéÜ‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) Find out here what the weather will be doing this weekend üëá [pic.twitter.com/J4RRab7bDw] [December 29, 2023] New Year's revellers have been warned to travel early to avoid travel chaos over the weekend. LNER suffered disruption on Friday due to "severe weather", with strong winds affecting parts of the East Coast Main Line. It meant a service due to run from Aberdeen to London King's Cross started from Newcastle. There has also been widespread disruption to rail services due to staffing shortages. A shortage of train crew at Edinburgh meant CrossCountry cancelled a number of trains to and from the station. Avanti West Coast axed several of it services to and from London Euston due to a staff shortage. Northern, which is also controlled by the Government, said it will run no services on six lines on Sunday - New Year's Eve - due to "train crew unavailability". The affected routes with a "Do Not Travel" alert connect Manchester Victoria with Chester and Stalybridge, Manchester Piccadilly with Chester via Altrincham, and Preston with Colne. There will also be no trains between Morecambe and Lancaster, or Clitheroe and Bolton. Services on other lines will finish earlier than usual at around 4pm. A Department for Transport spokesperson said: "While staffing is a matter for industry, we are working with them to ensure they are able to deliver the services that passengers need, making clear that we will hold them to account if they let passengers down."

author: Adri√°n Foncillas
title: Corea del Norte ordena la producci√≥n masiva de drones suicida
text: Carrera armament√≠stica Corea del Norte ordena la producci√≥n masiva de drones suicida El l√≠der norcoreano valora la efectividad y el escaso coste de los peque√±os artilugios usados en la guerra de Ucrania Corea del Norte ha abrazado a los drones con la fe del converso. Tras d√©cadas atareado en perfeccionar misiles y dem√°s armamento de guerras convencionales ha anunciado que sus f√°bricas despachar√°n sin pausa esos peque√±os artilugios voladores que se muestran tan √∫tiles en Ucrania. Lo ha anunciado su l√≠der, Kim Jong-un, tras atender a un ensayo militar resuelto con aparente √©xito. Las im√°genes de la KCNA, la agencia oficial norcoreana, muestran a Kim y sus oficiales paseando entre dos modelos diferentes de drones, pixelados para no darle pistas al enemigo. Otras fotograf√≠as muestran una berlina alemana y varios tanques despanzurrados. Los drones, detalla la agencia, "golpearon con precisi√≥n los objetivos" durante la prueba. Permiten ajustar la distancia del ataque y est√°n dise√±ados para alcanzar al enemigo en tierra y mar. Kim ha ordenado ya un sistema de producci√≥n en serie tan pronto sea posible. El viraje, aclara, supone la actualizaci√≥n de la teor√≠a militar vigente en su pa√≠s. Lo justifica el tercer eslab√≥n de la dinast√≠a en "los √©xitos que est√°n logrando los drones en peque√±os y grandes conflictos". No s√≥lo cuenta su acrisolada capacidad asesina: sus costes de producci√≥n son infinitesimales en comparaci√≥n con los de un misil de largo alcance y no exigen ninguna tecnolog√≠a compleja. Los drones, lanzados en oleadas para dificultar su neutralizaci√≥n, permiten causar da√±os enormes a enemigos bien armados. Inminente cargamento Corea del Norte no hab√≠a mostrado un especial inter√©s en los drones hasta ahora. Esta es s√≥lo la segunda prueba publicada en la prensa, tras la de agosto, y en sus desaf√≠os peri√≥dicos a su vecino del sur s√≥lo consta el env√≠o de cinco unidades a la isla de Ganghwa dos a√±os atr√°s. Pionyang lamenta con vehemencia que grupos de ultraderecha surcoreanos esparzan sobre su territorio propaganda cargada en drones lanzados desde la frontera. Ha respondido siempre con globos y esperado que los vientos hicieran el trabajo. Es un m√©todo con el encanto de lo artesanal que ahora podr√≠a afinar con el inminente cargamento de drones. Nadie ha mencionado a Ucrania en la prensa nacional pero es el destino m√°s probable de los artilugios voladores. Kim ya ha enviado millones de municiones y unos 10.000 hombres a Vlad√≠mir Putin desde que ambos firmaran en julio un acuerdo de defensa que incluye el auxilio mutuo si alguno de los pa√≠ses era atacado. En Pionyang sellaron una alianza con consecuencias imprevisibles en la pen√≠nsula coreana y que tambi√©n inquieta a China. Kim calific√≥ a Putin como el "m√°s querido amigo del pueblo coreano" y le mostr√≥ su "absoluto apoyo y solidaridad" en la guerra en Ucrania. El segundo le agradeci√≥ que ese apoyo fuera "constante e inquebrantable". "Me refiero a nuestra lucha contra la pol√≠tica hegem√≥nica impuesta durante d√©cadas, la pol√≠tica imperialista de Estados Unidos y sus sat√©lites contra la Federaci√≥n Rusa", a√±adi√≥. En combate en Ucrania Washington y Kiev han desvelado que las tropas de √©lite norcoreanas enviadas semanas atr√°s a la frontera ya han entrado en combate. No ser√°n decisivas para el signo de la guerra pero s√≠ influir√°n en zonas concretas como la de Kursk, donde est√°n acuarteladas. En ellos conf√≠a Putin para acelerar la liberaci√≥n de ese territorio invadido por Ucrania. Supone la primera misi√≥n en el extranjero de tropas norcoreanas y sobre su funci√≥n y relevancia s√≥lo hay hip√≥tesis. Corea del Norte ha regresado al desenfreno: amenazas semanales a Se√∫l, lanzamientos de misiles de largo alcance, ninguna esperanza de di√°logo y un v√≠nculo cada d√≠a m√°s f√©rreo con Mosc√∫. Pionyang ser√° el asunto m√°s relevante cuando esta semana se re√∫nan en la cumbre del Asia-Pac√≠fico el presidente surcoreano, Yoon Suk Yeol, el estadounidense, Joe Biden, y el primer ministro japon√©s, Shigeru Ishiba. author: Salem Reporter
title: UPDATED: Crews stop advance of Turner Road fire
text:
As of 7 p.m., fire crews are mopping up and monitoring the Turner Road fire and level 2 evacuations have been lifted.
Read an updated story on the fire here .
Turner Fire burns 30 acres of former prison farmland Evacuations LEVEL 3 GO NOW: The Marion County Sheriff‚Äôs Office has ordered a level 3 evacuation, meaning leave immediately, along Turner Road near Southeast Rising Iris Lane, due to the fire.
LEVEL 2 BE READY: People from Gath Road to Barcelona to Witzel South to Hideaway to Turner Road to Crawford Landing should be ready to evacuate at a moment‚Äôs notice, fire officials said. That includes the Crawford Crossing apartments near Turner Lake.
Road closures Southeast Turner Road is closed to all east and westbound traffic starting at Kuebler Road, Salem police said. Southbound traffic on Deerpark Drive is being diverted to westbound Mill Creek Road.
Fire updates 4:42 p.m. Fire crews have surrounded the Turner Fire and are continuing air drops of water.
Firefighters for now have stopped the fire‚Äôs advance south, but their primary concern is it spreading to the brush, said Salem Assistant Fire Chief Brian Carrara.
‚ÄúWe think we have it under control,‚Äù he said.
4:00 p.m. The Oregon State Fire Marshal deployed two ‚Äúfire boss‚Äù aircrafts from The Dalles to drop water on the blaze.
The Oregon State Fire Marshal‚Äôs Office deployed two ‚Äúfire boss‚Äù aircrafts from The Dalles to drop water on the fire Wednesday afternoon, July 9. (MADELEINE MOORE/Salem Reporter) 3:23 p.m. : The fire is about six acres and is burning south about a mile from the outskirts of Turner. The southwest corner of the fire is still growing, fire officials said.
Mike Schaufler, Turner mayor, said he‚Äôs monitoring the situation but not preparing to evacuate.
‚ÄúDry as a bone,‚Äù he said of the weather conditions.
Smoke from a fire burning along Southeast Gath Road was visible Wednesday, July 9, south of Salem. (MADELEINE MOORE/Salem Reporter) Wind is blowing from the north-northwest at about 5 to 8 MPH, pushing the fire southeast, according to meteorologist David Bishop of the National Weather Service‚Äôs Portland office.
‚ÄúAny wind has the potential to pick up embers and cause spotting,‚Äù he said.
The fire appears to be near the border of state land owned by the Department of Corrections and a Salem company.
Sean Blackburn of Salem-based Herron Crossing LLC said on Wednesday he had been informed of the fire on the company‚Äôs land by some of the tenants. Blackburn said many of the structures on the property are old barns and that he has tenants running a cattle ranching operation.
2:40 p.m. : GO NOW: The Marion County Sheriff‚Äôs Office has ordered a level 3 evacuation, meaning leave immediately, along Turner Road near Southeast Rising Iris Lane, due to the fire.
The area is sparsely populated with a few homes.
Original story:
A roughly 5-acre grass fire has spread to multiple structures in a field along Southeast Gath Road, according to Salem Fire Department officials.
Multiple barns on fire were visible from a nearby road, with roofs caving in. No injuries are reported.
Fire crews were attempting to contain the fire around 2:30 p.m. by closing down surrounding roads. Dispatch records showed eight units dispatched to the fire with a ninth unit en route.
The land is near the Oregon State Correctional Institution, a medium-security prison, and Corban University.
The fire was sparked by a downed power pole which fell after a vehicle crashed into it at the intersection of Gath and Turner roads, according to the Marion County Sheriff‚Äôs Office.
Crews were dispatched around 1:45 p.m.
Deputies have closed Gath Road between Turner Road and Witzel Road to respond to the crash.
Nearly 160 households near Southeast Turner Road had lost power as of 2:40 p.m. Wednesday, according to Portland General Electric‚Äôs outage map .
The Marion County Sheriff‚Äôs Office said a crash downed wires from a power pole, sparking a fire near Southeast Gath and Turner Roads Wednesday afternoon, July 9. (Watch Duty) This story is developing and will be updated.
CORRECTION: A previous version of this story misspelled Southeast Witzel Road. Salem Reporter apologizes for the error.
RELATED COVERAGE: Turner Fire burns 30 acres of former prison farmland
Contact reporter Joe Siess: joe@salemreporter.com or 503-335-7790.

author: Victor Alexander
title: DraftKings Expands Electric Poker to Pennsylvania
text:
DraftKings has introduced its Electric Poker game to a new audience by launching it in its second state, Pennsylvania. This latest move opens the door for millions of new players to experience one of the company‚Äôs most exciting gaming innovations. With Electric Poker now available in Pennsylvania, the game continues to make waves, offering players an online poker experience like no other.
Electric Poker Reaches Pennsylvania Initially rolled out earlier this year, Electric Poker first made its debut in Michigan. Following its success there, the game has now expanded to Pennsylvania, showcasing DraftKings ‚Äô drive to introduce the game to a broader market. As the operator continues to explore additional opportunities, Pennsylvania is just the next step in this growth journey.
Although Electric Poker shares some features with other online poker games, it also brings fresh twists. The game follows a 3-handed No-Limit Texas Hold‚Äôem format, but with a few notable differences. For example, prize pools are determined by a random draw, and blind levels increase every two minutes, adding an extra layer of excitement.
One standout feature of Electric Poker is its ‚ÄúElectric Mode.‚Äù This mode automatically activates after a short period and forces all players to go all-in, increasing the intensity and engagement. With this feature, the game keeps players on their toes and adds a thrilling dimension to the usual poker mechanics.
Buy-Ins and Prizes in Electric Poker Players can choose from a variety of buy-in levels, which range from $1 to $25. Depending on the buy-in size, players are matched with opponents of similar stakes, keeping the game balanced and competitive. The potential prizes are impressive, with rewards ranging from 2x a player‚Äôs buy-in to a massive 10,000x. While the higher multipliers are less common, they offer the chance for substantial payouts that can add to the excitement of each game.
The prize distribution system in Electric Poker is also unique. In games with a multiplier of 4x or lower, the winner takes the entire prize pool. However, for multipliers between 5x and 10x, the top two players split the prize. In cases where the multiplier exceeds 100x, all participants receive a portion of the winnings, ensuring that everyone gets a piece of the action.
Michigan‚Äôs Success Sparks Pennsylvania Expansion DraftKings decided to expand Electric Poker to Pennsylvania after witnessing overwhelming enthusiasm from Michigan players. The game has quickly become a favorite within DraftKings‚Äô exclusive lineup of casino offerings . DraftKings Casino, which debuted in 2018, operates in multiple states, including Connecticut, New Jersey, Michigan, Pennsylvania, and West Virginia, and is also available in Ontario, Canada. Electric Poker is just one of the standout offerings exclusive to DraftKings Casino, adding variety and innovation to the platform‚Äôs gaming options.
In response to the fantastic feedback from our Michigan players, we are excited to expand our Electric Poker offerings to Pennsylvania.
Jason March, DraftKings‚Äô vice president of iGaming, highlighted the game‚Äôs unique appeal and expressed excitement over its Pennsylvania launch. He emphasized that players in Michigan responded very positively to Electric Poker, prompting the decision to roll it out in Pennsylvania. March stated that Electric Poker offers an unparalleled experience that players won‚Äôt find elsewhere, which is why the company was eager to bring the game to a larger audience.
‚ÄúIn response to the fantastic feedback from our Michigan players, we are excited to expand our Electric Poker offerings to Pennsylvania, providing our customers with an online poker experience that stands out from the rest,‚Äù said March.
Online Poker Online poker is a digital version of the traditional card game played over the internet, allowing players from around the world to participate in various formats like Texas Hold‚Äôem, Omaha, and Seven-Card Stud. The convenience of playing from anywhere, combined with the accessibility of real money and free games, has contributed to its widespread popularity. Players can log into poker rooms or apps, join cash games, tournaments, or sit-and-go events, and compete for real money or play chips. This virtual poker space removes geographical barriers and offers round-the-clock availability, making it highly attractive to both casual players and professional grinders.
The online poker industry has seen significant growth, particularly since the early 2000s, thanks in part to the rise of major platforms like PokerStars, 888poker, and partypoker. These platforms dominate the space, offering a wide variety of games, stakes, and tournaments with large prize pools. PokerStars, for example, is renowned for hosting prestigious events such as the World Championship of Online Poker (WCOOP). Meanwhile, 888poker and partypoker are known for their player-friendly interfaces and lucrative promotions, attracting millions of users globally. The increased accessibility of online poker, along with advancements in mobile technology, has solidified its position as a dominant form of online entertainment.
DraftKings Expands Its Reach Beyond Poker Beyond the poker realm, DraftKings is also making strides in other areas of its gaming portfolio. Recently, the company expanded its capabilities in golf betting by acquiring Dijon Systems, a subsidiary of Mustard Systems. This acquisition aligns with DraftKings‚Äô goal to enhance its offerings in golf and further solidify its position in the sports betting market . As DraftKings continues to innovate and expand, Electric Poker is just one example of how the company is pushing the boundaries of online gaming.
CoinPoker: A Top Blockchain Platform for Poker Enthusiasts For poker players who are also fans of digital currencies, CoinPoker offers a distinctive and exciting platform. Unlike traditional online poker sites, CoinPoker operates on blockchain technology, giving users a secure, transparent, and trustworthy environment. Beyond poker, the platform also features sports betting, and its full integration of cryptocurrency sets it apart from more conventional poker platforms, offering a modern alternative for online gaming.
Merging Blockchain with Online Poker CoinPoker leverages cryptocurrency to provide fast and secure transactions, which eliminates the delays commonly experienced on traditional poker sites. This focus on speed and security has helped the platform build a reputation as both user-friendly and reliable. Although CoinPoker may not offer the extensive range of games seen on larger poker platforms, its dedication to fairness and its use of blockchain technology make it an appealing choice for players looking for a more transparent poker experience.
Looking Ahead: CoinPoker‚Äôs Vision for the Future As the online gaming industry evolves, CoinPoker is at the forefront of the poker world‚Äôs transition to blockchain. The platform is not only enhancing the way poker is played but also setting new standards in online gaming by providing more secure and private gameplay environments.
CoinPoker is constantly expanding its offerings, with plans to introduce new game styles and tournament formats to cater to a wider range of players. Its community-driven approach encourages greater user interaction, creating a more dynamic and engaging experience. With regular updates and new features, CoinPoker remains dedicated to offering its players the best possible poker experience.
Experience Blockchain Poker with CoinPoker For poker enthusiasts interested in decentralized gaming, CoinPoker offers an unmatched experience. Whether you‚Äôre a poker veteran or new to the game, this platform combines blockchain technology and poker to create a thrilling and secure gaming environment. By joining CoinPoker, players can experience the future of poker, powered by blockchain innovation.
Since its launch in 2017, CoinPoker has been a trailblazer, merging blockchain technology with online poker. Initially, it began as a free-to-play platform but introduced real-money games in 2018, allowing players to bet using various cryptocurrencies. The platform‚Äôs native token, CHP (Chip), plays an integral role in rewarding players and enabling quick transactions. author: David Harsanyi
title: RFK Jr. keeps peddling his detestable, debunked autism lies
text:
Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has spread many detestable theories in his life, but none is more detestable than his scaremongering over autism and vaccines.
It‚Äôs not merely that the new Health and Human Services secretary has convinced thousands of Americans that they‚Äôre partially responsible for their children‚Äôs autism ‚Äî a trend he once compared to a ‚Äúholocaust.‚Äù
It‚Äôs that he‚Äôs ensuring thousands more will put their children in needless danger for absolutely no scientific or rational reason.
One of Kennedy‚Äôs claims is the lie that Americans have seen a huge spike in autism cases over the past 40 years.
Autism rates, RFK said during his Senate confirmation hearings , ‚Äúhave gone from 1 in 10,000 [in 1980] . . . and today in our children, it‚Äôs 1 in 34.‚Äù
Kennedy repeated this statistic during his swearing-in ceremony . ‚ÄúWho can believe that?‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something wrong. There‚Äôs something wrong, and I think it‚Äôs something that can be found out.‚Äù
President Trump repeated this statistic on Truth Social and in his executive order instituting the Make America Healthy Again Commission.
Where the 1-in-10,000 number comes from, however, is a mystery.
Even in 1966, when autism was diagnosed as a child being socially isolated and showing withdrawn behavior, researchers estimated that around 1 in 2,500 children were autistic.
Maybe next Kennedy will go back to 1943, the year autism was first designated a condition, and only 1 in 100 million Americans were diagnosed.
The idea that anyone had any useful handle on the number of autistic children in the past, much less used the same criterion we do, is preposterous.
Autism wasn‚Äôt even a separate diagnosis from schizophrenia in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders until 1980, the year Kennedy said the affliction began rising.
Before 1991, the federal government lumped children with autism in with other ‚Äúintellectual disabilities.‚Äù In 1994, the definition of autism included Asperger syndrome and children on the milder end of the spectrum.
Researchers didn‚Äôt start trying to track autism until 2000. It wasn‚Äôt until 2006 that the American Academy of Pediatrics recommended screening all children for autism during routine pediatrician visits in the first two years, and many still did not.
It wasn‚Äôt until 2013 that present guidelines were instituted.
Even now, there‚Äôs no objective test for autism ‚Äî no blood test, say ‚Äî for diagnosis. So the prevalence of autism has varied greatly between states, which points to different levels of awareness and testing.
States like Rhode Island and Maryland have higher percentages than Louisiana and Texas.

Check out more newsletters When Sen. Bill Cassidy, a physician, implored the HHS nominee to ‚Äúreassure mothers unequivocally and without qualification‚Äù that vaccines do not cause autism, RFK would not.
‚ÄúIf the data is there, I will absolutely do that,‚Äù Kennedy responded. ‚ÄúNot only will I do that, but I will apologize for any statements that misled people otherwise.‚Äù
No, he won‚Äôt. Because tons of data already exist, and Kennedy keeps ignoring it, repeating debunked claims and creating fear.
Let‚Äôs momentarily set aside the fact that studies have shown autism likely begins in the womb, long before any vaccines are even given to children.
Kennedy made his name in the anti-vaccine movement by contending in Rolling Stone and other publications that there was a link between thimerosal, a preservative, and the ‚Äúepidemic of childhood neurological disorders.‚Äù
Indeed, he wrote that the government ‚Äúcolluded with Big Pharma to hide the risks of thimerosal from the public.‚Äù
There was never a shred of evidence this was true, and, in due time, the publications all retracted Kennedy‚Äôs pieces.
 Indeed, RFK ignored numerous CDC studies that found no connection between the two.
In 2004, researchers in Denmark ‚Äî a nation with highly accurate centralized health records ‚Äî conducted a study of every child vaccinated in that country between 1971 and 2000 and found that there ‚Äúwas no trend toward an increase in the incidence of autism during that period when thimerosal was used.‚Äù
Once thimerosal was removed from most vaccines over these fears, Kennedy moved on to spreading unfalsifiable paranoia about alleged unknown factors in MMR shots causing a giant spike in autism.
At least 27 major studies have found no connection between MMR vaccines and autism .
How many studies will draw an apology from Kennedy? 28? 128?
Moreover, in 2013, a CDC study found no connection between the number of vaccine antibodies used and the risk of an autism diagnosis.
In 2015, JAMA published the largest randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial on vaccines ever done, analyzing the health records of over 95,000 children, and found that MMR vaccine did not increase the risk of autism.
Of course, it‚Äôs good to ‚Äúquestion science.‚Äù Serious people are out there doing it every day.
But if you spend your life ignoring the preponderance of the scientific evidence, you‚Äôre not ‚Äúquestioning science,‚Äù you‚Äôre just a quack. In this case, a dangerous one.
David Harsanyi is a senior writer at the Washington Examiner. Twitter @davidharsanyi

author: Christopher Johnson
title: Trump Shuts Down 25 USGS Centers That Monitor Drought And Flooding
text:
Above photo: Hammer Creek in Lebanon County, Pennsylvania is a part of the Chesapeake Bay Small Agricultural Watershed Monitoring Program, and the Pennsylvania Water Science Center that was targeted to be closed. Scott Heidel, PADEP / USGS.
More than two dozen United States Geological Service (USGS) centers that monitor the country‚Äôs waters for flooding and drought , as well as manage water supply levels to make sure communities don‚Äôt run out, have had their leases terminated by the Trump administration.
The 25 centers being targeted are part of a network that tracks the quality and levels of surface and ground water , reported The Guardian. The data the centers‚Äô employees and equipment provide plays a crucial role in protecting human life and property while maintaining water supplies and helping to clean up oil and chemical spills .
In the aftermath of a chemical or oil spill , USGS data tracks plumes with real-time monitoring in some locations to protect drinking water , Inside Climate News reported.
‚ÄúThese [centers] are just super, super important, and there‚Äôs no rhyme or reason, no thought at all given to canceling these leases,‚Äù said Kyla Bennett, a scientist and attorney who is the science policy director of Public Employees for Environmental Responsibility. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre doing it because it‚Äôs convenient, because these particular centers happen to be up for renewal.‚Äù
No plan to fill the gaps left by the closed USGS centers has been indicated by the administration.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not being done with any thought about human life, it was just ‚Äòthis seems so woke so let‚Äôs get rid of it,‚Äô‚Äù Bennett said, as reported by The Guardian. ‚ÄúPeople think water is free and comes out of your tap whenever you want, but it‚Äôs not that simple.‚Äù
The General Services Administration ordered cancellation of the leases, according to an employee of one of the water centers who requested to remain anonymous for fear of retribution. The employee was informed of the closure by their landlord.
Centers across the country will begin closing within four months.
‚ÄúNobody knows what happens if we‚Äôre not doing [monitoring for drought conditions],‚Äù the employee said.
One of the most important functions provided by the centers is the part they play in flood warnings throughout the U.S. USGS monitors river levels and shares its data with the National Weather Service. The weather service then determines if precipitation levels from a coming storm added to the river‚Äôs water levels will bring about flooding or overflow a dam.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre doing everything we can to make the argument that we need these facilities to complete our mission,‚Äù the employee stated, adding that it was hard for the groups to fight back.
One of the centers slated for closure is the one in Charlotte, North Carolina , that managed the aftereffects of the deadly flooding from Hurricane Helene in Asheville late last year.
The centers are also responsible for measuring water levels of aquifers to make sure industry and utilities are not overdrawing them. Without this service, communities could run out of water. The data from USGS monitoring systems informs the water conservation requirements and drought declarations of states, which trigger withdrawal limits.
‚ÄúInformation on the flow of rivers is a vital national asset that safeguards lives, protects property, and ensures adequate water supplies for the future. The USGS is the federal agency responsible for operating a network of about 7,000 streamgages nationwide,‚Äù USGS said on its website . ‚ÄúData from this network are used by water managers, emergency responders, utilities, environmental agencies, universities, consulting firms, and recreation enthusiasts.‚Äù
One of the centers that will close when its lease runs out is in Moab, Utah. Currently 77 percent of the state is under drought conditions, and the center measures its water resources, including snowpack, which provides 95 percent of the state‚Äôs water, Inside Climate News reported.
The data is ‚Äúabsolutely foundational to our understanding of the current and past hydrology,‚Äù of the state, said Candice Hasenyager, Utah Division of Water Resources director, and shapes its long-term water planning.
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt really know how they would manage it if that office was closed,‚Äù Hasenyager said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre very concerned about being able to manage our water resources within the state of Utah‚Äù without USGS assistance, as well as that of other targeted federal programs.
Data from the centers is also used to manage pollution discharge permits and safeguard the quality of drinking water. Bennett pointed out that, when there are drought conditions, streams are prone to drying up and discharges must be stopped; otherwise, industrial discharge could completely inundate small streams.
‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt manage what you can‚Äôt measure,‚Äù said Blake Bingham, deputy state engineer of the Utah Division of Water Rights.
